pull.title: qa: generate --> generatetoaddress change to allow tests run without wallet
pull.body:
Addresses #14216 . Changed Changed `get_deterministic_priv_key()` to return named tuple`(address, key)` 
I have tried to be exhaustive as possible in maximum coverage for non-wallet mode without affecting any coverage for wallet mode.   

However, I could not check the tests in wallet mode because of timeout issues. Hopefully, travis job checks those.

Tests `feature_block.py`, `feature_logging.py` and `feature_reindex.py` were skipping despite having no direct dependency on any wallet functions. So, I have also disabled the `skip_test_no_wallet()` for those files too.

events.message:
Changed functional tests which do not require wallets to run without

skipping  .Addreses #14216. Changed get_deterministic_priv_key() to a

named tuple

rename.to: qa: generate --> generatetoaddress change to allow tests run without wallet

events.body:
utACK 0ca4c8b, left 2 comments but aren't worth the effort of a pull.

Agree with @laanwj in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/14216#issuecomment-421543645. IIUC this change improves coverage when wallet is not enabled since the tests are not skipped.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,17 +100,18 @@ def __init__(self, i, datadir, *, rpchost, timewait, bitcoind, bitcoin_cli, mock
 
     def get_deterministic_priv_key(self):
         """Return a deterministic priv key in base58, that only depends on the node's index"""
+        address_key_pair = collections.namedtuple('address_key_pair', ['address', 'key'])
comments.body:
namedtuple defines a type: please use CamelCase for the name (e.g. `AddressKeyPair`) and define it outside of the function
(see other uses of namedtuple for consistency)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,17 +100,18 @@ def __init__(self, i, datadir, *, rpchost, timewait, bitcoind, bitcoin_cli, mock
 
     def get_deterministic_priv_key(self):
         """Return a deterministic priv key in base58, that only depends on the node's index"""
+        address_key_pair = collections.namedtuple('address_key_pair', ['address', 'key'])
comments.body: Fixed. Thanks for pointing out, I will make sure to read existing conventions for future PR's.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,7 @@
 import tempfile
 import time
 import urllib.parse
+import collections

@@ -38,26 +38,24 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 3
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
-
     def setup_network(self):
         self.setup_nodes()
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Ensure submitblock can in principle reorg to a competing chain")
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
+        gen_address = lambda i: self.nodes[i].get_deterministic_priv_key().address  # A non-wallet address to mine to
comments.body: nit, in remaining tests this auxiliary function is not used, maybe it could be removed and inline where necessary.

@@ -38,26 +38,24 @@ def set_test_params(self):

     def run_test(self):

-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
+        gen_address = lambda i: self.nodes[i].get_deterministic_priv_key().address  # A non-wallet address to mine to
comments.body: There are 5 instances of calling `gen_address` in this test. I think in-lining would make this test overly verbose.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -38,26 +38,24 @@ def set_test_params(self):

     def run_test(self):

-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
+        gen_address = lambda i: self.nodes[i].get_deterministic_priv_key().address  # A non-wallet address to mine to
comments.body: IMO it should be consistent, which helps in moving code around, copy&paste and readability. So either expose the auxiliary function or inline everywhere.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -38,26 +38,24 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 3
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
-
     def setup_network(self):
         self.setup_nodes()
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Ensure submitblock can in principle reorg to a competing chain")
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
+        gen_address = lambda i: self.nodes[i].get_deterministic_priv_key().address  # A non-wallet address to mine to
comments.body: My rationale was make a clean looking code. Wherever there were many occurrences for the call to `get_deterministic_priv_key()`, I used a variable (in 1 test case where there was only 1 node) and auxiliary function in this test(where there are multiple nodes).
